name: Cuscuta mantiqueirana
typeLocations: holotype SP;isotype K;isotype MBM;isotype NY;isotype R;isotype SPF;isotype UB;isotype UEC;isotype WLU
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);Rio de Janeiro (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);São Paulo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);
locality: Minas Gerais: Camanducaia, Monte Verde. Parasita com ramos desde alaranjados até vináceos, sempre em local sombreado e humido
remarks: Etymology: 'The specific epithet is a feminine adjective that comes from the name of the mountain range to which the species is apparently endemic. The word 'Mantiqueira' is derived from Tupi-Guarani meaning 'mountains that cry' alluding perhaps to the plethora of dripping water, streams and rivers that are present during the wet season with abundant rainfall'. doi:10.3897/phytokeys.184.69037
